page.title: 17FARMING IN PENTON,CUMBRIA.
page.content: Farming is the main industry.There are 13 farms in the Block.They are either dairy or stock rearing farms,both rearing sheep.The land is managed grassland but there are areas of rough pasture and forestry.Most farms produce potatoes and turnips.The turnips are fed to cattle and sheep. Hay and silage is made for bedding and feed.Concentrates are also fed. A variety of suitable{breeds of cattle are kept:Friesian,Angus,Ayrshire, Hereford and Charolais pure and cross breeds. {Breeds of sheep } include:Suffolks,Border Leicester, cheviot and Scottish Blackface.. Milk is stored in bulk tanks being collected daily by tanker for Carlisle Some is bottled and some is processed into powdered milk.Stock is auctioned in Longtown and Carlisle.
